intro: Pterosenecio, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plants typically have hairy stems and produce showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. Pterosenecio species are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in dry to semi-arid conditions. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
